chargeHist.descr: Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater

result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrel Tate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
  ALSO, ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES IMPOSED IN COUNT 2 ARE TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*Restitution is set at ZERO.

*Obtain and maintain employment.
*Obtain GED or HSED.

*No firearms; weapons.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management and continued programming.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemded appropriate.
Parenting Classes.

*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
**11-12-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend  30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC. 

*This time is stayed pending a review on 12/11/15 at 1:30pm Branch 38.

supervisions.notes: *Court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during period of probation imposed in Count 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrel Tate

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-11-15 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time

Defendant Darrel Tate not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Probation Agent is in court and advises that the defendant has left the state.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Darrel Tate in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Darrel Tate in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon motion of the state, the court will delete the Domestic Abuse Repeater enhancer as to each count.
AS to count 1 and 2:      Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Victim has been notified and does not appear.  Victim Impact statement has not been provided; there is no restitution.  Statements to the court by all parties.
Count 1:
 Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to any other sentence.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:30pm Branch 38.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. Parenting classes.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  ALSO, ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES IMPOSED IN COUNT 2 ARE TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-Obtain GED or HSED
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at ZERO.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.
Count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 132 in the House of Correction, with credit for 132 days time served.  Court orders all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during period of probation imposed in court 1.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Darrel Tate not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 8-4-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Defendant Darrel Tate in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Defendant Darrel Tate in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Case heard for Br. 04.  

Attorney Schleis is accepting a new job and moves to withdraw.  Upon questioning by the Court, defendant WITHDRAWS the Speedy Trial Demand.  Court grants motion to withdraw subject to the public defender's office appointing new counsel.  Court cancels the jury trial.  Case set for status of counsel.  
  Status conference scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Due to branch 4 in trial, case transferred to branch 44 for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.   mld
to Withdraw as Counsel of Record, from Attorney Adam Schleis for defendant, received and filed.   mld
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION FOR BAIL REDUCTION OR MODIFICATION.  FILED BY ATTORNEY ADAM SCHLEIS.kl

Defendant Darrel Tate in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Defendant Darrel Tate in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court took judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the criminal complaint regarding the domestic violence surcharges against defendant on case 2013CM4786.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Bauer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion for dismissal of case without argument is heard and denied denied by the Court.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Discovery, offer letter and discovery demand was turned over to defense counsel from the State.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-10-2015 at 1:30 pm and Jury Trial on 6-24-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND BREATHALYZER TESTS.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ERICA D.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrel Tate in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Darrel Tate in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 04.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
